text.tspan: Events:
- Met and formed party at the Leeward Rest, a waystation inn.
- Fought goblins, of the Rotfang Brigade, pillagers and attackers of opportunity. They were hardy and quick to flee.
- Came across Alator the enchanted cart maker, an orc. Tells us of bandits ahead of us, 1 or 3 days ride. Also in red and gold, but likely not Xadgnian, instead like Cado Kan.
- stuff ruffled thru during the night -- work of flutterfoxes. Khunbish and I immediately are set on domesticating some.
- We come across a dead male halfling on the road, but there's no blood. Valna takes 3 yellowing vials from the body and posion herbs; is cagey about her interest in them.

- a panda protecting a red/gold/white dressed and masked human-esque creature. We approach a little to scout out. Once the word 'bandits' is mentioned, the bear lunges and we get into a melee that's unresolved but eventually halted. overheard between the people (KK)
"The choir speaks with one voice." - leader (grand master xendo)
"The hands make the will manifest." - chanted response
- we start encountering giant holes and scree along the road, seem to have appeared out of nowhere
- another camping night; bait some ffoxes and manage to retrieve a couple of the previously rummaged items
- cause of holes, a burrower, red magical amnesia-inducing eyes
- We continue on to the Jade Crow (at the crossroads of Twins Glade)

- they say the KK not popular there; we meet a Riun trader, Anastasia and her man pal Jorgen. She considers me uncouth and ignorant. He's terrifically shy and perhaps interested. She's trading on behalf of "gold hat, board, odds & ends."
- that halfling is alive; Kenneck wizzlegrass his name, and he's upset b/c his spirutally bound dog was taken by the goblins and he needs to retrieve it

- we head N w/Kenneck to probe the goblins home for information. Trapped in a field by fey nymph and touched by one of the creatues leaving me somewhat necrotic spot on my back. We're also later attacked by big mantis things

- finally entering the caves, we find dead humans, naturalists from the college of the unseen we discover by their left journals, studying mushrooms and such searching for cause of goblin flight from the caves
- we stay at the White Swan Inn in town
- meet Hao, the town elder, and discover that some of Kava's monastery refugees (~5) had fled thru Twins Glade, heading east toward the port. He'd later attack Kava and Khunbish, perhaps as a test?

- we beat the burrowers (umberholts), give some remains (I try to fashion some of its chiten into bracers) to Hao who can salt the earth with it; kenneck resurrects his dog, I heal Felix's disease. Kaliska, Va'len and Valna bond a bit over celebratory drinks
- We come across Alator again; he doesn't remember us at all

- Valen talked with an acquitance, Theo, who recommended we seek out Alvera back at the Jade Crow. We do that. She's a (fiery haired) dragon cultist who has magic to send people back in time to recover "lost artifacts" (loot). She demands it has to be now.
- khunbish crit fucked; I save him with lay on hands
- turned out to be yet another test; needs retcon here of my anger. I expressed that at time, but didn't play out the scene forcefully enough. Alvera tried to say it was Pixie's idea.

- we meet Drake (male magical scholar human cleric of pelor, very taciturn); pixie, a dyed hot pink large tabaxi female who's very ADD; and Skeebo: a wild-haired gnome of questionable alchemical abilities

- heading N again, we come across two other merchants, Feena (M) and Karbos (M) who warn of KK having control of the market up ahead, the Quad Gate Market. They're not selling much aside from empty bottles and they're wary of joining our burgeoning caravan.
- big thunderstorm arrives
- I have a steed now! Details TBD, some kind of direwolf [use Warhorse stats?]

- we spy some xadgnian guards off the road (still haven't reached the market) and we end up in tousle and get overrun. Khunbish saves me with a blink-like spell. We escape (no help from the dragon hunting crew) and Felix left behind with the Xadnians, but unharmed and perhaps with cover intact.
- Dehoni, my wolf
- we plan to continue to the market; valna follows the tracks as they headed west (toward monasteries), and we head north along the road. At double time, I'll be exhausted.
- market under control of "Warlord Hidetsu, the Ebon Ox" (he's huge); we camp and get long rest
- Drake sends incantation message to Felix asking about his whereabouts and health
- Felix replies he's safe but not free and that the monasteries are under imminent siege from 30 soldiers
- Valen, Kava, and me going to KK to talk to them into seeing if we can get them to join us. Valna and Khunbish to prep the cart.
- Warlord appears to be subject to flattery? Audience with the warlord: convince him to join/let us join him in his attack on them.
- I get a lance
- Felix sends us a message: "En route to you. Playing harmless merchants. Escorted by seven. Stay put."
- We take the cart and try to pose as merchants leaving ahead of the KK; trying to intercept Felix before the battle
- We do that. His retinue was Xadgnian soldiers. We drop the pretense of merchant quickly, they want us to spy/infiltrate the monasteries to the west. They're definitely looking for something.
- Hunting hawks, KK spies, are spotted by all, and we start double-time to the Xadgnian camp.

- The group preps a distraction to break away from the Xadgnians. Felix says it's not safe for us at the camp. They sabotage the cart wheel. And at that time, KK assassins appear and together, we dispatch all the Xadgnians, capturing most/all alive to bring back to the Quad gate market.

- Felix informs us there's ~20 Xadgnians left at the camp, they're hitting the monasteries looking for something; unknown what. And they're not building supply lines or doing any of the prep work you'd do for an extended methodical campaign. It's a smash and run.
- Questioned why he helped fight them, Felix says he's upset at the Xadgnian's casual nature to their foot soliders. I can understand this.

- Alvira tells us she's discovered that there was an old wizard, Laz Belgrave. He had a female Xadgnian assistant that still lives. Laz came up with something for transmutation. And the assistant has a scale from a black dragon, the King of Skulls. She thinks the assistant is in southern Xadgnian.
- We decide to think on next steps after a night's rest in the Quad Market. We'll want to talk to Warlord Hidetsu if we can, but also head toward the monasteries first
Cast
Andrew -- Felix Namisov? -- heavily armored half-elf, mostly human. Xadgnian ex-soldier. Starting a business of trading. Open. (Warrior Bard)

Molly -- Hkunbish -- teenage male tiefling, originally yellow monk ropes, vaguely mongolian features, gold iris in eyes, small hooves, a tail, black horns curling back. Nephew (adopted?) of Kava. Very peppy. Monk.
Geri -- Va'len Mystwalker -- male high-elf, is fabulous, well attired, pale skin. Loathe to do anything physical.

Steph -- Kahva Deekim -- large (6'+), mature female dragonborn. Somewhat golish in color. historian. From destroyed monastery, ransacked, scrolls stolen. Kahva and Khunbish were out when it happened. No clues as to who or why aside from a red and gold banner that's Xadgnian.
Mike -- Valna Lafayette -- female wood elf, silver hair, crimson beret, chestnut skin, carpenter tools, but proficient with a long bow
Me -- Kaliska Mystrun
Notes to self: voice, in character acting, decide how she'd interact with the others
To do: Mom story, adult background, oath of vengeance
